description: Job templates enable you to preconfigure jobs so that you can deploy them to multiple sets of target devices.

ExpiresInSec.description: How number (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of an IAM role that grants grants permission to download files from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.

ExponentialRolloutRate.description: Allows you to create an exponential rate of rollout for a job.

RateIncreaseCriteria.description: The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.

BaseRatePerMinute.description: The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to define the initial rate of rollout.

IncrementFactor.description: The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.

InProgressTimeoutInMinutes.description: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of this job.

AbortCriteria.description: The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.

Action.description: The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.

FailureType.description: The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.

ThresholdPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to initiate the job abort.

MinNumberOfExecutedThings.description: The minimum number of things which must receive job execution notifications before the job can be aborted.

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

JobArn.description: Optional for copying a JobTemplate from a pre-existing Job configuration.

TimeoutConfig.description: Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job.

JobExecutionsRolloutConfig.description: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

MaximumPerMinute.description: The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.

ExponentialRolloutRate.description: The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an exponential rate for a job rollout.

Description.description: A description of the Job Template.

DocumentSource.description: An S3 link to the job document to use in the template. Required if you don't specify a value for document.

AbortConfig.description: The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.

Document.description: The job document. Required if you don't specify a value for documentSource.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the JobTemplate.
